reviews.review_msg: Ryan is one of my fav profs at SFU. Class was mainly graded on two critical reviews and along with some quizzes and worksheets. He gives you guidance on how to critique the articles, and gives tips on how to write it. Super helpful, great lectures, and it made the papers easier to write. Make sure to do the readings and worksheets youl be fine!

Ryan is a great prof, super fun and attentive to students. Our class was based on weekly quizzes, four critical reviews from weekly readings and two major papers. He would guide us through the material and how to write and critically analyze articles, which was super helpful. 1000/10 recommend.

took 268 with him spring 2023, now taking 376 spring 2024. absolute favourite prof I've ever had. so charismatic and a great lecturer, keeps up with communication and always makes sure assessments are fair. ryan is literally my celebrity crush and i want him to teach more courses so i can take them with him. ryan if you see this, i love you *mwah*

Would NOT recommend this prof. Lacks empathy, will not help you if you are struggling with personal issues. Exams r way harder than shud be for 2nd year. All ur grade relies on his exams. Would rather find ANY other prof. Worst prof in all of my uni experience. Do not waste ur $ and time.
Ryan is a really good lecturer, I would definitely take another class with him. Grading was based on attendance and 3 exams, but he drops your lowest grade which is very helpful.
One of the best profs I've had so far at SFU. He's super understanding and his criteria is always clear. Is very helpful if you approach him.
Graded by participation and two exams.

Ryan has been the best prof I've ever had! Lectures are genuinely engaging & interesting, easy to follow, assignments feel fair, & the course felt stress-free because there were no exams. I actually WANTED to attend lecture. Ryan is also a very accessible prof. He was very understanding when I had to email him about a missing assignment. Recommend!

Loved Ryan, he explains concepts very clearly & not only this but his lectures are interesting. The critical review assignments help prepare you for the big review at the end of the semester (worth 50%). I had Will Fox as a TA & honestly, I've never met a more understanding TA. Both of them are fantastic, understanding people. 10/10 would recommend

Lectures were dry and you learn more from the lower division level. Your grade was based on papers that had nothing to do with the actual subject of the class. If you are planning on taking this class be aware that on his grading scale a C+ is 67-72%

Dr. Fitz was amazing. I thoroughly enjoyed my class with him this semester. His lectures are engaging and super interesting. Class consists of 2 Critical Reviews and quizzes worth 10% of your grade (all due at the end and you get unlimited attempts). Will definitely be looking for future classes that he's teaching.

Dr. Fitzgerald was incredible, I would take one of his courses again in a heartbeat. He is well-informed, ready to lecture and makes it interesting/interactive. He showed us how to make a critical review of articles we read, and use that information to write our assignments. Do wish he provided more info on how to write a strong crit review.

This class was marked by 3 papers. The papers were really fun -- We got to analyze three academic journal articles and critique it. It really made us dig deeper into these topics on our own. Ryan's really nice and helpful. He has clear guidelines on his assignments. He's also a quick responder, which is very appreciated. I definitely recommend him!

I loved his class! He did his best to keep his students engaged, and was fairly accomodating when everything switched to online. Definitely does his best to help his students, and is a fair grader as well. Would 100% take a class with him again!

I absolutely loved his class! The course was delivered as non-synchronized mini-lectures and grades were based on 3 papers only. He does his best to make the content interesting and his grading is fair. The papers help you learn the content thoroughly. I recommend this course only if you are interested in the topic and prefer working alone.

I took this class during the pandemic so it was done remotely. He made his class 100% papers, and did a podcast style lecture + optional Netflix episodes with discussions. Maybe because we were so limited, but I felt that I didn't learn anything from this class as all we were graded by was our research papers. It was an interesting class but hard.
